abstract: ESolar, a U.S. solar power company whose investors include Google and Oak Investment Partners, said it will help build a series of solar thermal power plants in China, as the country tries to decrease its reliance on coal, imported gas and oil.
snippet: ESolar, a U.S. solar power company whose investors include Google and Oak Investment Partners, said it will help build a series of solar thermal power plants in China, as the country tries to decrease its reliance on coal, imported gas and oil.
lead_paragraph: ESolar, an American solar power company whose investors include Google and Oak Investment Partners, said Saturday it would help build a series of solar thermal power plants in China, as the world’s biggest emitter of greenhouse gases tries to decrease its reliance on coal, imported gas and oil.

headline.main: ESolar Strikes Deal to Build China Plants
